DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Postoperative Brain Performed Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator relating to the assessment of the  spine/spinal cord and/or brain was executed through to completion utilizing imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Postoperative Brain Performed
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The assessment of the  spine/spinal cord and/or brain was executed through to completion utilizing imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation..

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
Any method that uses a visual display of structural or functional patterns of organs or tissues for diagnostic evaluation.

Property.preferredDefinition: After surgery.:An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.:Performed; carried out.

Concepts.definition: Relating to or occurring during the period immediately following a surgical operation.
An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.
Executed and carried through to completion.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The indicator relating to the results of an diagnostic imaging assessment.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.
Systematic, objective appraisal of the significance, effectiveness, and impact of activities or condition according to specified objectives and criteria.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

Concepts.definition: Indicates a task, process or examination that has either not been initiated or not been completed.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Was post-operative brain MRI
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was post-operative brain MRI with and without gadolinium performed prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was post-operative cranial MRI with and without gadolinium within 72 hours performed prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was post-operative cranial MRI with and without gadolinium performed within 72 hours of surgery, prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were brain MRI with and without gadolinium and spinal MRI performed prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were brain MRI with and without gadolinium and spinal MRI with gadolinium performed within 14 days of study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did the patient have a post-operative MRI for second surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 10
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was post-operative brain MRI with and without contrast performed prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was a post-operative brain MRI with and without gadolinium obtained within 72 hours of surgery and within 14 days prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 001
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were post-operative brain MRI tests performed (with and without contrast) prior to study entry?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Was a post-operative brain MRI with and without gadolinium obtained within 72 hours of surgery and within 31 days prior to enrollment?
